title: Print Type following in Avatar's footsteps?
content: Are we seeing the dawn of a new age in print design? [http://www.mcsweeneys.net/2010/3/8greenman.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012030640/http:/www.mcsweeneys.net/2010/3/8greenman.html "http://www.mcsweeneys.net/2010/3/8greenman.html")
author: penn

comments.content:
James Joyce, with the added feature of no punctuation.

_yes when I put the rose in my hair like the Andalusian girls used or shall I wear a red yes and how he kissed me under the Moorish wall and I thought well as well him as another and then I asked him with my eyes to ask again yes and then he asked me would I yes to say yes my mountain flower and first I put my arms around him yes and drew him down to me so he could feel my breasts all perfume yes and his heart was going like mad and yes I said yes I will Yes._

Not to mention Major Major.

I was lucky enough to get one of [these](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012030640/http:/www.marksimonson.com/article/227/typecon-2008-goodie-bag-postcards) from Mark Simonson at Typecon the summer before last.
